alert.note: Alert for Butler; Carter; Ripley (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 7:01PM CDT until June 08 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following areas, Butler, Carter and Ripley. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heaviest rain had come to an end. And while flooding has not been reported, some minor street flooding is still possible. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Locations most likely to have any lingering water problems include areas just northeast of Grandin, between Poplar Bluff and Batesville, and near and west of Qulin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
